overview_of_class: Mammalian physiology. We will examine the functioning of organisms at the cellular, tissue and organ/organ system level. Emphasis will be placed on control systems and the integration of organ systems to maintain homeostasis. Topics will include nervous, endocrine, sensory, renal, respiratory, muscular and cardiovascular system physiology.
name: Physiology
title: WCAS BIOL_SCI 217-0-20 Physiology
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must have completed CHEM 102-0 or CHEM 171-0 to register for this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Mammalian physiology. We will examine the functioning of organisms at the cellular, tissue and organ/organ system level. Emphasis will be placed on control systems and the integration of organ systems to maintain homeostasis. Topics will include nervous, endocrine, sensory, renal, respiratory, muscular and cardiovascular system physiology.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lectures comvined with problem solving sessions, including group/active learning activities.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Four quizzes and 2 non-cumulative exams (multiple choice, matching short answer and short essay)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
